metadata.title: CVE-2014-9293 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The config_auth function in ntpd in NTP before 4.2.7p11, when an auth keyis not configured, improperly generates a key, which makes it easier forremote attackers to defeat cryptographic protection mechanisms via abrute-force attack.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9293` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ntp - 1:4.2.6.p5+dfsg-3ubuntu2.14.04.1
ntpdate - 1:4.2.6.p5+dfsg-3ubuntu2.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ntp package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:4.2.6.p5+dfsg-3ubuntu2.14.04.1').
